channel.title: Newest Python PEPs
channel.description: Newest Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs) - Information on new language features, and some meta-information like release procedure and schedules.

item.title: PEP 8104: 2023 Term Steering Council election
item.description: This document describes the schedule and other details of the December 2022 election for the Python steering council, as specified in PEP 13. This is the steering council election for the 2023 term (i.e. Python 3.12).
item.author: Ee Durbin (ee@python.org)

item.title: PEP 700: Additional Fields for the Simple API for Package Indexes
item.description: PEP 691 defined a JSON form for the "Simple Repository API". This allowed clients to more easily query the data that was previously only available in HTML, as defined in PEP 503.
item.author: Paul Moore (p.f.moore@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 699: Remove private dict version field added in PEP 509
item.description: PEP 509 introduced a private ma_version_tag field for dictionaries to allow optimizations in CPython and extension libraries. This PEP proposes to rescind PEP 509 and declare the field an implementation detail, as it has already been superseded by alternatives. This will further allow the field to be reused for future optimization.
item.author: Ken Jin (kenjin@python.org)

item.title: PEP 698: Override Decorator for Static Typing
item.description: This PEP proposes adding an @override decorator to the Python type system. This will allow type checkers to prevent a class of bugs that occur when a base class changes methods that are inherited by derived classes.
item.author: Steven Troxler (steven.troxler@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 697: Limited C API for Extending Opaque Types
item.description: Add Limited C API for extending types with opaque data, by allowing code to only deal with data specific to a particular (sub)class.
item.author: Petr Viktorin (encukou@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 696: Type defaults for TypeVarLikes
item.description: This PEP introduces the concept of type defaults for TypeVarLikes (TypeVar, ParamSpec and TypeVarTuple), which act as defaults for a type parameter when one is not specified or the constraint solver isn't able to solve a type parameter to anything.
item.author: James Hilton-Balfe (gobot1234yt@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 695: Type Parameter Syntax
item.description: This PEP specifies an improved syntax for specifying type parameters within a generic class, function, or type alias. It also introduces a new statement for declaring type aliases.
item.author: Eric Traut (erictr at microsoft.com)

item.title: PEP 694: Upload 2.0 API for Python Package Repositories
item.description: There is currently no standardized API for uploading files to a Python package repository such as PyPI. Instead, everyone has been forced to reverse engineer the non-standard API from PyPI.
item.author: Donald Stufft (donald@stufft.io)

item.title: PEP 692: Using TypedDict for more precise \*\*kwargs typing
item.description: Currently **kwargs can be type hinted as long as all of the keyword arguments specified by them are of the same type. However, that behaviour can be very limiting. Therefore, in this PEP we propose a new way to enable more precise **kwargs typing. The new approach revolves around using TypedDict to type **kwargs that comprise keyword arguments of different types. It also involves introducing a grammar change and a new dunder __typing_unpack__.
item.author: Franek Magiera (framagie@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 693: Python 3.12 Release Schedule
item.description: This document describes the development and release schedule for Python 3.12. The schedule primarily concerns itself with PEP-sized items.
item.author: Thomas Wouters (thomas@python.org)
